description: a(n+1) is the smallest prime ending with (but not equal to) a(n), where a(1)=3.
links: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..210
maple: A[1]:= 3;for n from 2 to 100 dod:= 10^(ilog10(A[n-1])+1);for k from 1 do  p:= A[n-1]+d*k;  if isprime(p) then    A[n]:= p;    break  fiodod:seq(A[n],n=1..100); # _Robert Israel_, Jul 15 2014
author: _G. L. Honaker, Jr._, Jan 18 2000
